Talon


talon smiled at tucson while she took gently the nut and with out w=
ord she kissed him.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Panico <magicqua=
rtz@...> wrote:
>
> Tucson holds Talon gently with an arm around her should=
ers.  He looks up and then back to her.
> 
> " Like a branch on a tree that=
 has broken off during a storm and regrows in a different direction than it=
 had been, before it had broken off.  I know exactly how you feel.  I feel =
the same way.   At one time, I was blind, rolled on four wheels and I alway=
s seemed to be an Autobot rebel.  I fought along side with my comrades but =
I wasn't good at following orders.  I was well grounded but lost at the sam=
e time.  Then, I met you and things began to change on a more positive note=
.  You may not believe this, but you helped me to find my path, and you saw=
 me on the right road and guided me to my true fate.  Soon afterwards, I be=
came a Prime, acquired seventeen more wheels, and almost looked like Optimu=
s Prime, yet different.  But one thing didn't change, I was still battling =
blindness off and on.  Then, a third change, due to extensive damage to my =
previous form, which could not be repaired, I was guided to my final evolut=
ion, this one.  All of these things wouldn't have come about if I had never=
 met you.  And I wouldn't have it any other way.  Talon, I will miss this p=
lanet as much as you are, and hopefully we can tell our offspring all about=
 this planet and it's wondrous varieties of life that live here."
> 
> The =
rodent climbs down and drops a nut into his hand, and chatters to him.
> 
>=
 " This is for us to keep?  Thank you, we will take good care of it."
> 
> =
He places the nut in Talon's hand.
> 
> " I think we have a way to bring ba=
ck a small reminder of this planet.  Let's see if we can encourage it to gr=
ow on ours."
> 
> Local artist who specializes in illustration, using tradi=
tional and digital media.

eat for any occasion!

in count what I was... Its funny the turns that life has"

> > >
> > > Tucs=
on puts a gentile arm around Talon's shoulders and looks up into the branch=
es of the tree, but finds himself bonked on the head by a tree nut, which i=
s dropped by a rodent. He chuckles and gives the nut back to the rodent.
> =
> > 
> > > " You dropped this."
> > > 
> > > The rodent takes the nut back =
and vanishes into the tree to eat its prize. Tucson was one with the creatu=
res and it was obvious that they were comfortable around him. 
> > > 
> > >=
 " Talon, I'm going to miss this planet just as much as you are, when we le=
ave for Cybertron. It's just not going to feel like home the way this plane=
t does. But Leo is right, we can not remain here and upset the balance of t=
ime. But while we're still here, let's enjoy the moment and continue to exp=
lore this part of the forest."

> > > > > =
With a happy look on his face, Tucson walks with Talon, down the corridor a=
nd out to a walking trail which he had been down before but could not see. =
It was leading to the old dragon's cave. But the path itself carries a sere=
ne atmosphere as a gentile stream ripples over glistening river rocks while=
 dragonflies dodge the current of the water. And now, for the first time, T=
ucson could actually enjoy it visually as well as harmonically. 
> > > > > =

> > > > > " I've been this way once before, but I wanted to return here wh=
en it was possible for both of us to enjoy it together. And now, we can. I =
can see why Leo is concerned, so much innocent life, too valuable to destro=
y. The entire planet is a treasure within itself. And who better to enjoy t=
his treasure than with you? No one. I only hope that after we leave, this w=
orld will remain as pure as it is now. But there's more that I want to show=
 you."
> > > > > 
> > > > > He takes Talon into a forest of giant trees and=
 points upward.
> > > > > 
> > > > > " If you sit under this tree and look =
straight up, it appears to be reaching to the sky, yet it shades you from t=
he heat of the sun. It provides shelter and protection, yet it does so in a=
n innocent manner. It's something Master Yoketron taught me, when he was my=
 Sensai. See things with a different perspective and not always what everyo=
ne else sees. Here, I'll show you. "
> > > > > 
> > > > > He shows Talon to=
 a boulder beneath a large hardwood tree and sits right under it,looking up=
.
> > > > > 
> > > > > " If you sit right here beside me and look up, you'l=
l see what I mean."
